    â€–ğ’€^tâ€²,:âˆ’ğ’€^t,:â€–22\displaystyle\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤2â€‹â€–ğ’€^tâ€²,:âˆ’ğ‘¾tâ€²,:â€–22+2â€‹â€–ğ’€^t,:âˆ’ğ‘¾t,:â€–22â‰¤(r^)2â€‹logâ¡Tâ€‹HÎ´\displaystyle\leq 2\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t^{\prime},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}+2\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\leq(\widehat{r})^{2}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}â‰¤ 2 âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 2 âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ ( over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG
  • (iv)

    If ğ’¬tâˆ©â„kâ‰ âˆ…{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\neq\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  âˆ…, then ğ’¬tâˆ©â‹ƒkâ€²â‰ kâ„k=âˆ…{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap\bigcup_{k^{\prime}\neq k}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}=\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰  italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = âˆ…. We show this via reductio ad absurdum. Suppose there exists kâ‰ kâ€²k\neq k^{\prime}italic_k â‰  italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT such that ğ’¬tâˆ©â„kâ‰ âˆ…{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\neq\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  âˆ… and ğ’¬tâˆ©â„kâ€²â‰ âˆ…{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k^{\prime}}\neq\emptysetcaligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  âˆ…. Let tkâˆˆğ’¬tâˆ©â„kt_{k}\in{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and tkâ€²âˆˆğ’¬tâˆ©â„kâ€²t_{k^{\prime}}\in{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}\cap{\mathcal{I}}_{k^{\prime}}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then, by definition of ğ’¬t{\mathcal{Q}}_{t}caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT,

    r^â€‹logâ¡Tâ€‹HÎ´\displaystyle\widehat{r}\sqrt{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG square-root start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG â‰¥â€–ğ’€^tk,:âˆ’ğ’€^tkâ€²,:â€–2\displaystyle\geq\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}â‰¥ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    â‰¥â€–ğ‘¾tk,:âˆ’ğ‘¾tkâ€²,:â€–2âˆ’â€–ğ’€^tk,:âˆ’ğ‘¾tk,:â€–2âˆ’â€–ğ’€^tkâ€²,:âˆ’ğ‘¾tkâ€²,:â€–2\displaystyle\geq\left\lVert{\bm{W}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}-\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-{\bm{W}}_{t_{k^{\prime}},\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}\right\rVert_{2}â‰¥ âˆ¥ bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
    â‰¥Î”ğ‘¾âˆ’r^â€‹logâ¡Tâ€‹HÎ´.\displaystyle\geq\Delta_{\bm{W}}-\widehat{r}\sqrt{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}}.â‰¥ roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG square-root start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG .

    Recalling the definition of r^\widehat{r}over^ start_ARG italic_r end_ARG, one can easily check that if Hâ‰¥28â€‹SÎ”ğ‘¾2â€‹Î³psâ€‹logâ¡HÎ´â€‹logâ¡Tâ€‹HÎ´H\geq 2^{8}\frac{S}{\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{H}{\delta}\log\frac{TH}{\delta}italic_H â‰¥ 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 8 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_S end_ARG start_ARG roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG, above cannot be true, a contradiction.

Claim B.1.

K^=K\widehat{K}=Kover^ start_ARG italic_K end_ARG = italic_K.

Proof.

WLOG, assume that |â„1|â‰¥|â„2|â‰¥â‹¯â€‹|â„K||{\mathcal{I}}_{1}|\geq|{\mathcal{I}}_{2}|\geq\cdots|{\mathcal{I}}_{K}|| caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | â‰¥ | caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | â‰¥ â‹¯ | caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT |.

We first show that for each 1â‰¤kâ‰¤K1\leq k\leq K1 â‰¤ italic_k â‰¤ italic_K,

âˆƒtkâ‹†âˆˆâ‹ƒkâ€²âˆˆ[K]â„kâ€²âˆ–â‹ƒâ„“=1kâˆ’1ğ’®â„“s.t.|ğ’¬tkâ‹†âˆ–â‹ƒâ„“=0kâˆ’1ğ’®â„“|â‰¥|â„k|.\exists t_{k}^{\star}\in\bigcup_{k^{\prime}\in[K]}{\mathcal{I}}_{k^{\prime}}\setminus\bigcup_{\ell=1}^{k-1}{\mathcal{S}}_{\ell}\quad\text{s.t.}\quad\left|{\mathcal{Q}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}\setminus\bigcup_{\ell=0}^{k-1}{\mathcal{S}}_{\ell}\right|\geq|{\mathcal{I}}_{k}|.âˆƒ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ– â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT s.t. | caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ– â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ = 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_â„“ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | â‰¥ | caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | .

Due to the properties (iii) and (iv), and the greedy nature of lines 7-10, the above is indeed true.

Let {t1â‹†,â‹¯,tKâ‹†}\{t_{1}^{\star},\cdots,t_{K}^{\star}\}{ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , â‹¯ , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } be the selected â€œcentersâ€ with â„kâŠ†ğ’¬tkâ‹†{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\subseteq{\mathcal{Q}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ† caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Now, we show that after kkitalic_k has reached K+1K+1italic_K + 1 in line 10, the while loop terminates. By property (ii), the number of remaining trajectories is

|[T]âˆ–â‹ƒkâˆˆ[K]ğ’¬tkâ‹†|â‰¤|[T]âˆ–â‹ƒkâˆˆ[K]â„k|â€‹â‰¤(iâ€‹i)â€‹32â€‹Râ€‹Tlogâ¡Tâ€‹HÎ´,\left|[T]\setminus\bigcup_{k\in[K]}{\mathcal{Q}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}\right|\leq\left|[T]\setminus\bigcup_{k\in[K]}{\mathcal{I}}_{k}\right|\overset{(ii)}{\leq}\frac{32RT}{\log\frac{TH}{\delta}},| [ italic_T ] âˆ– â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k âˆˆ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | â‰¤ | [ italic_T ] âˆ– â‹ƒ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k âˆˆ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_I start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | start_OVERACCENT ( italic_i italic_i ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG â‰¤ end_ARG divide start_ARG 32 italic_R italic_T end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG ,

which is precisely the termination criterion at line 7. âˆ

Thus, if a trajectory ttitalic_t is misclassified in the sense that it gets assigned to tkâ€²â‹†t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT instead of tkâ‹†t_{k}^{\star}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, then it must be that â€–ğ’€^t,:âˆ’ğ’€^tkâ‹†â€–2>â€–ğ’€^t,:âˆ’ğ’€^tkâ€²â‹†â€–2.\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k}^{\star}}\right\rVert_{2}>\left\lVert\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t,\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}}-\widehat{{\bm{Y}}}_{t_{k^{\prime}}^{\star}}\right\rVert_{2}.âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , : end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_Y end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‹† end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . By the triangle inequality, this then implies that

âˆ

B.3 Proof of LemmaÂ B.3

As the exact constants for the â„“2\ell_{2}roman_â„“ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-distance concentration have been left to exercise in Canonne [2020], we provide the complete proof here.

First, we have that

ğ”¼â€‹[â€–p^Nâˆ’pâ€–22]\displaystyle\mathbb{E}\left[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\right]blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] =âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®ğ”¼â€‹[(p^Nâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s))2]\displaystyle=\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\mathbb{E}\left[(\hat{p}_{N}(s)-p(s))^{2}\right]= âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E [ ( over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ]
=1N2â€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®Varâ€‹[Binâ€‹(N,pâ€‹(s))]\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N^{2}}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\mathrm{Var}[\mathrm{Bin}(N,p(s))]= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Var [ roman_Bin ( italic_N , italic_p ( italic_s ) ) ] (Nâ€‹p^Nâ€‹(s)âˆ¼Binâ€‹(N,pâ€‹(s))N\hat{p}_{N}(s)\sim\mathrm{Bin}(N,p(s))italic_N over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) âˆ¼ roman_Bin ( italic_N , italic_p ( italic_s ) ))
=1Nâ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®pâ€‹(s)â€‹(1âˆ’pâ€‹(s))\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}p(s)(1-p(s))= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) ( 1 - italic_p ( italic_s ) )
=1Nâ€‹(1âˆ’âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®pâ€‹(s)2)\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N}\left(1-\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}p(s)^{2}\right)= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( 1 - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
â‰¤1Nâ€‹(1âˆ’1S),\displaystyle\leq\frac{1}{N}\left(1-\frac{1}{S}\right),â‰¤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_S end_ARG ) , (Cauchy-Schwartz inequality)

i.e., with Nâ‰¥4Îµ2â€‹(1âˆ’1S)N\geq\frac{4}{\varepsilon^{2}}\left(1-\frac{1}{S}\right)italic_N â‰¥ divide start_ARG 4 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_S end_ARG ),

ğ”¼â€‹[â€–p^Nâˆ’pâ€–2]â€‹â‰¤(âˆ—)â€‹ğ”¼â€‹[â€–p^Nâˆ’pâ€–22]â‰¤Îµ2,\mathbb{E}\left[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}\right]\overset{(*)}{\leq}\sqrt{\mathbb{E}\left[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}^{2}\right]}\leq\frac{\varepsilon}{2},blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] start_OVERACCENT ( âˆ— ) end_OVERACCENT start_ARG â‰¤ end_ARG square-root start_ARG blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] end_ARG â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ,

where (âˆ—)(*)( âˆ— ) follows from Jensenâ€™s inequality.

We now utilize the McDiarmidâ€™s inequalityÂ [McDiarmid, 1989] to turn this into a tight high-probability guarantee. For ğ’”N=(s1,â‹¯,sN){\bm{s}}_{N}=(s_{1},\cdots,s_{N})bold_italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â‹¯ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), let us define

f(ğ’”N):=âˆ¥p^Nâˆ’pâˆ¥2=âˆ‘i=1N(p^Nâ€‹(si)âˆ’pâ€‹(si))2.\displaystyle f({\bm{s}}_{N})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\|\hat{p}_{N}-p\|_{2}=\sqrt{\sum_{i=1}^{N}(\hat{p}_{N}(s_{i})-p(s_{i}))^{2}}.italic_f ( bold_italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) : = âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = square-root start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG .

Now, let ğ’”Â¬i=(s1,â€¦,siâˆ’1,siâ€²,si+1,â€¦,sN){\bm{s}}^{\neg i}=(s_{1},\dots,s_{i-1},s_{i}^{\prime},s_{i+1},\dots,s_{N})bold_italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Â¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for siâ€²âˆˆ{0,1}s_{i}^{\prime}\in\{0,1\}italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ { 0 , 1 } and p^NÂ¬i\hat{p}_{N}^{\neg i}over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Â¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be the empirical distribution using ğ’™Â¬i{\bm{x}}^{\neg i}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Â¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Observe that

|fâ€‹(ğ’”)âˆ’fâ€‹(ğ’”Â¬i)|\displaystyle|f({\bm{s}})-f({\bm{s}}^{\neg i})|| italic_f ( bold_italic_s ) - italic_f ( bold_italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Â¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) | =|â€–p^Nâˆ’pâ€–2âˆ’â€–p^NÂ¬iâˆ’pâ€–2|\displaystyle=\left|\|\hat{p}_{N}-p\|_{2}-\|\hat{p}_{N}^{\neg i}-p\|_{2}\right|= | âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Â¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT |
â‰¤â€–p^Nâˆ’p^NÂ¬iâ€–2\displaystyle\leq\|\hat{p}_{N}-\hat{p}_{N}^{\neg i}\|_{2}â‰¤ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT Â¬ italic_i end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (Triangle inequality)
=1Nâ€‹|siâˆ’siâ€²|â‰¤1N.\displaystyle=\frac{1}{N}|s_{i}-s_{i}^{\prime}|\leq\frac{1}{N}.= divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | â‰¤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG .

Thus, ffitalic_f satisfies the bounded difference property with ci=1/Nc_{i}=1/Nitalic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 / italic_N.

Combining everything, we have that

â„™â€‹(â€–p^Nâˆ’pâ€–2â‰¥Îµ)\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}\geq\varepsilon\right)blackboard_P ( âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Îµ ) â‰¤â„™â€‹(â€–p^Nâˆ’pâ€–2âˆ’ğ”¼â€‹[â€–p^Nâˆ’pâ€–2]â‰¥Îµ2)\displaystyle\leq{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}-\mathbb{E}[\left\lVert\hat{p}_{N}-p\right\rVert_{2}]\geq\frac{\varepsilon}{2}\right)â‰¤ blackboard_P ( âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - blackboard_E [ âˆ¥ over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_p âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) (with Nâ‰¥4Îµ2â€‹(1âˆ’1S)N\geq\frac{4}{\varepsilon^{2}}\left(1-\frac{1}{S}\right)italic_N â‰¥ divide start_ARG 4 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Îµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_S end_ARG ))
â‰¤expâ¡(âˆ’2â€‹(Îµ2)2Nâ€‹(1N)2)\displaystyle\leq\exp\left(-\frac{2\left(\frac{\varepsilon}{2}\right)^{2}}{N\left(\frac{1}{N}\right)^{2}}\right)â‰¤ roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG 2 ( divide start_ARG italic_Îµ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_N ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_N end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG )
=expâ¡(âˆ’Îµ2â€‹N2).\displaystyle=\exp\left(-\frac{\varepsilon^{2}N}{2}\right).= roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_Îµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) .

âˆ

Appendix C Proof of TheoremÂ 4.2 â€“ Likelihood Improvement

The proof largely follows the recipe of likelihood improvement for SBM clusteringÂ [Yun and ProutiÃ¨re, 2014b, a], which dates back to the seminal works of Abbe [2018], Amini etÂ al. [2013] and recently extended to other variants such as labeled SBMÂ [Yun and ProutiÃ¨re, 2016] and block Markov chainsÂ [Jedra etÂ al., 2023, Sanders etÂ al., 2020].

Let â„‹âŠ†[T]{\mathcal{H}}\subseteq[T]caligraphic_H âŠ† [ italic_T ] be the maximum subset satisfying the following: whenever tâˆˆfâˆ’1â€‹(k)âˆ©â„‹t\in f^{-1}(k)\cap{\mathcal{H}}italic_t âˆˆ italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) âˆ© caligraphic_H,

âˆ‘s,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®N^tâ€‹(s,sâ€²)â€‹logâ¡p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)p(kâ€²)â€‹(sâ€²|s)â‰¥Câ€‹(Hâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’ŸÏ€,âˆ€kâ€²â‰ k.\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\frac{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}\geq C(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi},\quad\forall k^{\prime}\neq k.âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG â‰¥ italic_C ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , âˆ€ italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰  italic_k . (31)

The first proposition bounds |â„‹âˆ||{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}|| caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | in-expectation, which then leads to a w.h.p. guarantee via Markovâ€™s inequality:

Proposition C.1.

Suppose that Hâ‰³Î·p2Î³psâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€â€‹logâ¡1Ï€minH\gtrsim\frac{\eta_{p}^{2}}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}\log\frac{1}{\pi_{\min}}italic_H â‰³ divide start_ARG italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. With C=12C=\frac{1}{2}italic_C = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG, We have that

ğ”¼â€‹[|â„‹âˆ|]â‰¤Tâ€‹(Kâˆ’1)â€‹expâ¡(âˆ’Î³psâ€‹(Hâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’ŸÏ€128â€‹(4â€‹Î·p2+5â€‹logâ¡Î·p)).\mathbb{E}[|{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}|]\leq T(K-1)\exp\left(-\frac{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}{128(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\right).blackboard_E [ | caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | ] â‰¤ italic_T ( italic_K - 1 ) roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 128 ( 4 italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) . (32)

Thus, by Markovâ€™s inequality, we have that

â„™â€‹(|â„‹âˆ|â‰¥Tâ€‹expâ¡(âˆ’Î³psâ€‹(Hâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’ŸÏ€256â€‹(4â€‹Î·p2+5â€‹logâ¡Î·p)))â‰¤Kâ€‹expâ¡(âˆ’Î³psâ€‹(Hâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’ŸÏ€256â€‹(4â€‹Î·p2+5â€‹logâ¡Î·p)).{\mathbb{P}}\left(|{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}|\geq T\exp\left(-\frac{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}{256(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\right)\right)\leq K\exp\left(-\frac{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}{256(4\eta_{p}^{2}+5\log\eta_{p})}\right).blackboard_P ( | caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | â‰¥ italic_T roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 256 ( 4 italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) ) â‰¤ italic_K roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 256 ( 4 italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 5 roman_log italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG ) . (33)

We next show that all trajectories in â„‹{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H are correctly classified with high probability:

Proposition C.2.

Suppose that the following requirements on HHitalic_H and TTitalic_T hold:

Hâ‰³1Î³psâ€‹(S2â€‹logâ¡Tâˆ¨1vminâ€‹logâ¡Tâ€‹HÏ€minâˆ¨Î·pâ€‹Î·Ï€â€‹Râ€‹SÎ±minâ€‹Hâ€‹Î”ğ‘¾2â€‹ğ’ŸÏ€â€‹logâ¡(Tâ€‹H)),Tâ€‹Hâ‰³(Sâ€‹logâ¡T)2Î³psâ€‹Î±minâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€2.H\gtrsim\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\left(S^{2}\log T\vee\frac{1}{v_{\min}}\log\frac{TH}{\pi_{\min}}\vee\frac{\eta_{p}\eta_{\pi}RS}{\alpha_{\min}H\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}\log(TH)\right),\ TH\gtrsim\frac{(S\log T)^{2}}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\alpha_{\min}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{2}}.italic_H â‰³ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log italic_T âˆ¨ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ¨ divide start_ARG italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( italic_T italic_H ) ) , italic_T italic_H â‰³ divide start_ARG ( italic_S roman_log italic_T ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG . (34)

Then, all trajectories in â„‹{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H are correctly classified with probability at least 1âˆ’1Ï€minâ€‹Tâˆ’1Tâ€‹H1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}T}-\frac{1}{TH}1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_T end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_T italic_H end_ARG.

Note that the probability in Eqn.Â (33) goes to 0 as Tâ†’âˆT\rightarrow\inftyitalic_T â†’ âˆ. from our requirement that Hâ‰³logâ¡TH\gtrsim\log Titalic_H â‰³ roman_log italic_T (ignoring other factors). Then, the proof concludes by taking the worst-case, namely, that all the trajectories in â„‹âˆ{\mathcal{H}}^{\complement}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are misclassified, and applying a union bound. âˆ

C.1 Proof of PropositionÂ C.1

First note that

â‰¤(Kâˆ’1)â€‹âˆ‘tâˆˆ[T]maxkâ€²â‰ fâ€‹(t)âˆˆ[K]â¡â„™â€‹(âˆ‘s,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®N^tâ€‹(s,sâ€²)â€‹logâ¡p(fâ€‹(t))â€‹(sâ€²|s)p(kâ€²)â€‹(sâ€²|s)<Câ€‹(Hâˆ’1)â€‹ğ’ŸÏ€â€‹(t;kâ€²)),\displaystyle\leq(K-1)\sum_{t\in[T]}\max_{k^{\prime}\neq f(t)\in[K]}{\mathbb{P}}\left(\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\frac{p^{(f(t))}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}<C(H-1){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})\right),â‰¤ ( italic_K - 1 ) âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ [ italic_T ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰  italic_f ( italic_t ) âˆˆ [ italic_K ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_P ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG < italic_C ( italic_H - 1 ) caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) ,

where we denote ğ’ŸÏ€(t;kâ€²):=ğ’ŸÏ€(fâ€‹(t),kâ€²)=âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®Ï€(fâ€‹(t))(s)ğ–ªğ–«(p(fâ€‹(t))(â‹…|s),p(kâ€²)(â‹…|s)){\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}(t;k^{\prime})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}={\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{(f(t),k^{\prime})}=\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\pi^{(f(t))}(s)\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}(p^{(f(t))}(\cdot|s),p^{(k^{\prime})}(\cdot|s))caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ; italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) : = caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) sansserif_KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) ).

As done in Sanders etÂ al. [2020], Jedra etÂ al. [2023], define an â€œaugmentedâ€ Markov chain, Xt,h:=(st,h,st,h+1)X_{t,h}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=(s_{t,h},s_{t,h+1})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). For notational simplicity, let us denote p:=p(fâ€‹(t))p\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=p^{(f(t))}italic_p : = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Ï€=Ï€(fâ€‹(t))\pi=\pi^{(f(t))}italic_Ï€ = italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

This is a Markov chain on ğ’®Ã—ğ’®{\mathcal{S}}\times{\mathcal{S}}caligraphic_S Ã— caligraphic_S, with transition probability kernel p~â€‹(st,h+1,st,h+2|st,h,st,h+1)=pâ€‹(st,h+2|st,h+1)\tilde{p}(s_{t,h+1},s_{t,h+2}|s_{t,h},s_{t,h+1})=p(s_{t,h+2}|s_{t,h+1})over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and stationary distribution Ï€~â€‹(s,sâ€²)=Ï€â€‹(s)â€‹pâ€‹(sâ€²|s)\tilde{\pi}(s,s^{\prime})=\pi(s)p(s^{\prime}|s)over~ start_ARG italic_Ï€ end_ARG ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_Ï€ ( italic_s ) italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ). We have the following property that we provide the proof at the end:

Lemma C.1.

The pseudo-spectral gap of Xt,hX_{t,h}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is also Î³\gammaitalic_Î³.

Now define a function Ï•kâ€²:ğ’®Ã—ğ’®â†’â„\phi_{k^{\prime}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}{\mathcal{S}}\times{\mathcal{S}}\rightarrow{\mathbb{R}}italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : caligraphic_S Ã— caligraphic_S â†’ blackboard_R as

Ï•kâ€²(Xt,h):=âˆ‘s,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®ğŸ™[st,h=s,st,h+1=sâ€²]logpâ€‹(sâ€²|s)p(kâ€²)â€‹(sâ€²|s)=logpâ€‹(st,h+1|st,h)p(kâ€²)â€‹(st,h+1|st,h).\phi_{k^{\prime}}(X_{t,h})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\mathds{1}[s_{t,h}=s,s_{t,h+1}=s^{\prime}]\log\frac{p(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s^{\prime}|s)}=\log\frac{p(s_{t,h+1}|s_{t,h})}{p^{(k^{\prime})}(s_{t,h+1}|s_{t,h})}.italic_Ï• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) : = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG = roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG . (35)

(AssumptionÂ 2)

Proof of LemmaÂ C.1.

For notational simplicity, we omit the dependency on ttitalic_t. Let ğ‘·{\bm{P}}bold_italic_P and ğ‘·~\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG be the (bounded) linear operators corresponding to the original Markov chain shs_{h}italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the augmented Markov chain Xh:=(sh,sh+1)X_{h}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=(s_{h},s_{h+1})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : = ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), respectively. Then, it is clear that ğ‘·~=â¨sâˆˆğ’®ğ‘·\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}=\bigoplus_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}{\bm{P}}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG = â¨ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_P, where â¨\bigoplusâ¨ denotes the (matrix) direct sum.

We now denote ğ‘·âˆ—{\bm{P}}^{*}bold_italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and ğ‘·~âˆ—\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}^{*}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be their adjoints on L2â€‹(Ï€)L^{2}(\pi)italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Ï€ ) and L2â€‹(Ï€~)L^{2}(\tilde{\pi})italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_Ï€ end_ARG ), respectively, i.e., their time reversalsÂ [Lezaud, 1998]. By a well-known property of direct sumÂ [Horn and Johnson, 2012], we have that ğ‘·~âˆ—=â¨sâˆˆğ’®ğ‘·âˆ—\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}^{*}=\bigoplus_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}{\bm{P}}^{*}over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = â¨ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. This can also be seen via explicit computation:

p~âˆ—(y,yâ€²|x,xâ€²):=Ï€~â€‹(y,yâ€²)â€‹p~â€‹(x,xâ€²|y,yâ€²)Ï€~â€‹(x,xâ€²)=Ï€â€‹(y)â€‹pâ€‹(yâ€²|y)â€‹pâ€‹(xâ€²|x)â€‹ğŸ™â€‹[yâ€²=x]Ï€â€‹(x)â€‹p~â€‹(xâ€²|x)=Ï€â€‹(y)â€‹pâ€‹(x|y)Ï€â€‹(x)âŸ=pâˆ—â€‹(y|x)ğŸ™[yâ€²=x].\tilde{p}^{*}(y,y^{\prime}|x,x^{\prime})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\frac{\tilde{\pi}(y,y^{\prime})\tilde{p}(x,x^{\prime}|y,y^{\prime})}{\tilde{\pi}(x,x^{\prime})}=\frac{\pi(y)p(y^{\prime}|y)p(x^{\prime}|x)\mathds{1}[y^{\prime}=x]}{\pi(x)\tilde{p}(x^{\prime}|x)}=\underbrace{\frac{\pi(y)p(x|y)}{\pi(x)}}_{=p^{*}(y|x)}\mathds{1}[y^{\prime}=x].over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_y , italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x , italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) : = divide start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Ï€ end_ARG ( italic_y , italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG ( italic_x , italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_y , italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_Ï€ end_ARG ( italic_x , italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG = divide start_ARG italic_Ï€ ( italic_y ) italic_p ( italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_y ) italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x ) blackboard_1 [ italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x ] end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï€ ( italic_x ) over~ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_x ) end_ARG = underâŸ start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_Ï€ ( italic_y ) italic_p ( italic_x | italic_y ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Ï€ ( italic_x ) end_ARG end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_y | italic_x ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x ] .

The off-diagonal zero blocks correspond to where ğŸ™â€‹[yâ€²=x]=0\mathds{1}[y^{\prime}=x]=0blackboard_1 [ italic_y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_x ] = 0.

Thus, we have that for every kâˆˆâ„•k\in{\mathbb{N}}italic_k âˆˆ blackboard_N, (ğ‘·~âˆ—)kâ€‹ğ‘·~k=â¨sâˆˆğ’®(ğ‘·âˆ—)kâ€‹ğ‘·k(\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}^{*})^{k}\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}^{k}=\bigoplus_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}({\bm{P}}^{*})^{k}{\bm{P}}^{k}( over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = â¨ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, i.e., the spectrum of (ğ‘·~âˆ—)kâ€‹ğ‘·~k(\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}^{*})^{k}\widetilde{{\bm{P}}}^{k}( over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is precisely SSitalic_S copies of that of (ğ‘·âˆ—)kâ€‹ğ‘·k({\bm{P}}^{*})^{k}{\bm{P}}^{k}( bold_italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ— end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. This immediately implies that Î³psâ€‹(ğ‘·~)=Î³psâ€‹(ğ‘·)\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}(\widetilde{{\bm{P}}})=\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}({\bm{P}})italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG bold_italic_P end_ARG ) = italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_P ). âˆ

C.2 Proof of PropositionÂ C.2

Recall that

â„’(k;t):=âˆ‘h=1Hâˆ’1logp^0(k)(st,h+1|st,h)=âˆ‘s,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®N^t(s,sâ€²)logp^0(k)(sâ€²|s){\mathcal{L}}(k;t)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\sum_{h=1}^{H-1}\log\widehat{p}_{0}^{(k)}(s_{t,h+1}|s_{t,h})=\sum_{s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\log\widehat{p}_{0}^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)caligraphic_L ( italic_k ; italic_t ) : = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) roman_log over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) (36)

where

p^0(k)(sâ€²|s):=âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)âˆ‘hâˆˆ[Hâˆ’1]ğŸ™â€‹[st,h=s,st,h+1=sâ€²]âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)âˆ‘hâˆˆ[Hâˆ’1]ğŸ™â€‹[st,h=s].\widehat{p}_{0}^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\frac{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}\sum_{h\in[H-1]}\mathds{1}[s_{t,h}=s,s_{t,h+1}=s^{\prime}]}{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}\sum_{h\in[H-1]}\mathds{1}[s_{t,h}=s]}.over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) : = divide start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h âˆˆ [ italic_H - 1 ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h âˆˆ [ italic_H - 1 ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 [ italic_s start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t , italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_s ] end_ARG . We then bound the intermediate estimation error of the transition probabilities:

Lemma C.2.

Let Î´âˆˆ(0,1)\delta\in(0,1)italic_Î´ âˆˆ ( 0 , 1 ), and suppose that Hâ‰³1Î³psâ€‹Ï€minH\gtrsim\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\pi_{\min}}italic_H â‰³ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Then, for each kâˆˆ[K]k\in[K]italic_k âˆˆ [ italic_K ] and s,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®s,s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S, the following holds with probability at least 1âˆ’Î´1-\delta1 - italic_Î´:

|logâ¡p^0(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)|â‰²1Î³psâ€‹Î±kâ€‹Tâ€‹Hâ€‹Ï€(k)â€‹(s)â€‹p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)â€‹logâ¡Î±kâ€‹TÏ€minâ€‹Î´â€‹logâ¡1Ï€minâ€‹Î´+Î·pâ€‹Î·Ï€â€‹e(0)Î±kâ€‹T.\left|\log\frac{\widehat{p}_{0}^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}\right|\lesssim\sqrt{\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\alpha_{k}TH\pi^{(k)}(s)p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}\log\frac{\alpha_{k}T}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}\log\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}}+\frac{\eta_{p}\eta_{\pi}e^{(0)}}{\alpha_{k}T}.| roman_log divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG | â‰² square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T italic_H italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG . (40)

For simplicity, let tâˆˆfâˆ’1â€‹(k)t\in f^{-1}(k)italic_t âˆˆ italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ). By union bound, we have that with probability at least 1âˆ’1Ï€minâ€‹T21-\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}T^{2}}1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG,

With this, we deduce that tâˆˆâ„‹t\in{\mathcal{H}}italic_t âˆˆ caligraphic_H is misclassified only if

Hâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€â‰²âˆ’E1,t<E2,t+E3,tâ‰²Sâ€‹HÎ³psâ€‹Î±minâ€‹Tâ€‹logâ¡T+Î·pâ€‹Î·Ï€Î±minâ€‹Râ€‹SÎ³psâ€‹Î”ğ‘¾2â€‹logâ¡(Tâ€‹H),H{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}\lesssim-E_{1,t}<E_{2,t}+E_{3,t}\lesssim S\sqrt{\frac{H}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\alpha_{\min}T}}\log T+\frac{\eta_{p}\eta_{\pi}}{\alpha_{\min}}\frac{RS}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}}\log(TH),italic_H caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰² - italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 , italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰² italic_S square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG end_ARG roman_log italic_T + divide start_ARG italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG divide start_ARG italic_R italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( italic_T italic_H ) ,

where the first inequality follows from the definition of â„‹{\mathcal{H}}caligraphic_H. By taking the contrapositive, we can deduce that if both

Hâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€â‰³Sâ€‹HÎ³psâ€‹Î±minâ€‹Tâ€‹logâ¡Tâ€‹Â andÂ â€‹Hâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€â‰³Î·pâ€‹Î·Ï€Î±minâ€‹Râ€‹SÎ³psâ€‹Î”ğ‘¾2â€‹logâ¡(Tâ€‹H)H{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}\gtrsim S\sqrt{\frac{H}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\alpha_{\min}T}}\log T\text{ and }H{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}\gtrsim\frac{\eta_{p}\eta_{\pi}}{\alpha_{\min}}\frac{RS}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}}\log(TH)italic_H caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰³ italic_S square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_H end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG end_ARG roman_log italic_T and italic_H caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰³ divide start_ARG italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG divide start_ARG italic_R italic_S end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log ( italic_T italic_H )

hold, then tâˆˆâ„‹t\in{\mathcal{H}}italic_t âˆˆ caligraphic_H must be classified correctly after one-shot likelihood improvement. C.3 Proof of LemmaÂ C.2

We denote Nt(s):=(Hâˆ’1)Ï€(fâ€‹(t))(s)N_{t}(s)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=(H-1)\pi^{(f(t))}(s)italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) : = ( italic_H - 1 ) italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) and Nt(s,sâ€²):=(Hâˆ’1)Ï€(fâ€‹(t))(s)p(fâ€‹(t))(sâ€²|s)N_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=(H-1)\pi^{(f(t))}(s)p^{(f(t))}(s^{\prime}|s)italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) : = ( italic_H - 1 ) italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_t ) ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) as the expected number of visitations/transitions under the respective chainâ€™s stationary distribution.

As x1+xâ‰¤logâ¡(1+x)â‰¤x\frac{x}{1+x}\leq\log(1+x)\leq xdivide start_ARG italic_x end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_x end_ARG â‰¤ roman_log ( 1 + italic_x ) â‰¤ italic_x for x>âˆ’1x>-1italic_x > - 1, we have that

|logâ¡p^0(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)|\displaystyle\left|\log\frac{\widehat{p}_{0}^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}\right|| roman_log divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG |
â‰¤|p^0(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)âˆ’1|\displaystyle\leq\left|\frac{\widehat{p}_{0}^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}-1\right|â‰¤ | divide start_ARG over^ start_ARG italic_p end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG - 1 |
=|âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)N^tâ€‹(s,sâ€²)âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)N^tâ€‹(s)â€‹1p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)âˆ’1|\displaystyle=\left|\frac{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})}{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}\frac{1}{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}-1\right|= | divide start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG - 1 |
=|âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)N^tâ€‹(s,sâ€²)âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)Ntâ€‹(s,sâ€²)â€‹âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)Ntâ€‹(s)âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)N^tâ€‹(s)âŸâ‰œEeâ€‹sâ€‹tâ€‹âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)Ntâ€‹(s,sâ€²)âˆ‘tâˆˆ(f^0)âˆ’1â€‹(k)Ntâ€‹(s)â€‹1p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)âŸâ‰œEcâ€‹lâ€‹uâ€‹sâ€‹tâ€‹eâ€‹râˆ’1|.\displaystyle=\left|\underbrace{\frac{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})}{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}N_{t}(s,s^{\prime})}\frac{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}N_{t}(s)}{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}\widehat{N}_{t}(s)}}_{\triangleq E_{est}}\underbrace{\frac{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}N_{t}(s,s^{\prime})}{\sum_{t\in(\widehat{f}_{0})^{-1}(k)}N_{t}(s)}\frac{1}{p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}}_{\triangleq E_{cluster}}-1\right|.= | underâŸ start_ARG divide start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ ( over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - Defining Xt:=N^t(s,sâ€²)âˆ’Nt(s,sâ€²)X_{t}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})-N_{t}(s,s^{\prime})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : = over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), note that XtX_{t}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPTâ€™s are independent across ttitalic_t and satisfy ğ”¼Ï€â€‹[Xt]=0\mathbb{E}_{\pi}[X_{t}]=0blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] = 0. Let us define an event â„³:={|Xt|â‰¤M,âˆ€tâˆˆf^0âˆ’1(k)}{\mathcal{M}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\left\{|X_{t}|\leq M,\ \forall t\in\widehat{f}_{0}^{-1}(k)\right\}caligraphic_M : = { | italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | â‰¤ italic_M , âˆ€ italic_t âˆˆ over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) }, where M>0M>0italic_M > 0 is chosen later. By LemmaÂ B.5 and the fact that |f^0âˆ’1â€‹(k)|â‰¤3â€‹Î±kâ€‹T2|\widehat{f}_{0}^{-1}(k)|\leq\frac{3\alpha_{k}T}{2}| over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) | â‰¤ divide start_ARG 3 italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG, we have

â„™(|âˆ‘tâˆˆf^0âˆ’1â€‹(k)(N^t(s,sâ€²)âˆ’Nt(s,sâ€²))|â‰¥z|â„³)â‰¤1Ï€minexp(âˆ’z26â€‹M2â€‹Î±kâ€‹T).{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left|\sum_{t\in\widehat{f}_{0}^{-1}(k)}\left(\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})-N_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\right)\right|\geq z\middle|{\mathcal{M}}\right)\leq\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}}\exp\left(-\frac{z^{2}}{6M^{2}\alpha_{k}T}\right).blackboard_P ( | âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) | â‰¥ italic_z | caligraphic_M ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_z start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 6 italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG ) .

We choose Mâ‰Hâ€‹Ï€â€‹(s)â€‹pâ€‹(sâ€²|s)Î³psâ€‹logâ¡Î±kâ€‹TÏ€minâ€‹Î´M\asymp\sqrt{\frac{H\pi(s)p(s^{\prime}|s)}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{\alpha_{k}T}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}}italic_M â‰ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_H italic_Ï€ ( italic_s ) italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG. Then, by Eqn.Â (39), we have that â„™â€‹(â„³âˆ)â‰¤Î´2.{\mathbb{P}}({\mathcal{M}}^{\complement})\leq\frac{\delta}{2}.blackboard_P ( caligraphic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¤ divide start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG . By reparametrizing zâ‰Mâ€‹Î±kâ€‹Tâ€‹logâ¡1Ï€minâ€‹Î´z\asymp M\sqrt{\alpha_{k}T\log\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}}italic_z â‰ italic_M square-root start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG and union bound, we have that

â„™â€‹(|âˆ‘tâˆˆf^0âˆ’1â€‹(k)(N^tâ€‹(s,sâ€²)âˆ’Ntâ€‹(s,sâ€²))|â‰¥Î±kâ€‹Tâ€‹Hâ€‹Ï€â€‹(s)â€‹pâ€‹(sâ€²|s)Î³psâ€‹logâ¡Î±kâ€‹TÏ€minâ€‹Î´â€‹logâ¡1Ï€minâ€‹Î´)â‰¤Î´.\displaystyle{\mathbb{P}}\left(\left|\sum_{t\in\widehat{f}_{0}^{-1}(k)}\left(\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})-N_{t}(s,s^{\prime})\right)\right|\geq\sqrt{\frac{\alpha_{k}TH\pi(s)p(s^{\prime}|s)}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}}\log\frac{\alpha_{k}T}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}\log\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}}\right)\leq\delta.blackboard_P ( | âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) | â‰¥ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T italic_H italic_Ï€ ( italic_s ) italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG ) â‰¤ italic_Î´ .

Then, combining everything, the following holds with probability at least 1âˆ’Î´1-\delta1 - italic_Î´:

|âˆ‘tâˆˆf^0âˆ’1â€‹(k)N^tâ€‹(s,sâ€²)âˆ‘tâˆˆf^0âˆ’1â€‹(k)Ntâ€‹(s,sâ€²)âˆ’1|â‰²1Î³psâ€‹Î±kâ€‹Tâ€‹Hâ€‹Ï€â€‹(s)â€‹pâ€‹(sâ€²|s)â€‹logâ¡Î±kâ€‹TÏ€minâ€‹Î´â€‹logâ¡1Ï€minâ€‹Î´.\left|\frac{\sum_{t\in\widehat{f}_{0}^{-1}(k)}\widehat{N}_{t}(s,s^{\prime})}{\sum_{t\in\widehat{f}_{0}^{-1}(k)}N_{t}(s,s^{\prime})}-1\right|\lesssim\sqrt{\frac{1}{\gamma_{\mathrm{ps}}\alpha_{k}TH\pi(s)p(s^{\prime}|s)}\log\frac{\alpha_{k}T}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}\log\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi_{\min}}\delta}}.| divide start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_N end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t âˆˆ over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_s , italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG - 1 | â‰² square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î³ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_ps end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T italic_H italic_Ï€ ( italic_s ) italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG end_ARG . =âˆ‘tâˆˆğ’0(k)p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)â€‹Ntâ€‹(s)+âˆ‘tâˆˆâ„°0(k)p(f^0â€‹(t))â€‹(sâ€²|s)â€‹Ntâ€‹(s)(âˆ‘tâˆˆğ’0(k)Ntâ€‹(s)+âˆ‘tâˆˆâ„°0(k)Ntâ€‹(s))â€‹p(k)â€‹(sâ€²|s)\displaystyle=\frac{\sum_{t\in{\mathcal{C}}_{0}^{(k)}}p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)N_{t}(s)+\sum_{t\in{\mathcal{E}}_{0}^{(k)}}p^{(\widehat{f}_{0}(t))}(s^{\prime}|s)N_{t}(s)}{\left(\sum_{t\in{\mathcal{C}}_{0}^{(k)}}N_{t}(s)+\sum_{t\in{\mathcal{E}}_{0}^{(k)}}N_{t}(s)\right)p^{(k)}(s^{\prime}|s)}= i.e., we can bound Ecâ€‹lâ€‹uâ€‹sâ€‹tâ€‹eâ€‹rE_{cluster}italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_l italic_u italic_s italic_t italic_e italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT as

|Ecâ€‹lâ€‹uâ€‹sâ€‹tâ€‹eâ€‹râˆ’1|â‰¤2â€‹Î·pâ€‹Î·Ï€â€‹e(0)Î±kâ€‹T.|E_{cluster}-1|\leq\frac{2\eta_{p}\eta_{\pi}e^{(0)}}{\alpha_{k}T}.| italic_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c italic_l italic_u italic_s italic_t italic_e italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 | â‰¤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_ARG . (44)

Combining everything, we are done. âˆ

Appendix D Deferred Proofs from SectionÂ 5

D.1 Proof of PropositionÂ 5.1 â€“ Relationship between different gaps

D.1.1 (a) Relationship between ğ’ŸÏ€{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Kausik etÂ al. [2023]â€™s Î±,Î”\alpha,\Deltaitalic_Î± , roman_Î”

We first recall the following lemma connecting the KL divergence and the L2L_{2}italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-distance between two probability measures on a finite state space ğ’®{\mathcal{S}}caligraphic_S:

Lemma D.1.

For two probability mass functions p,qp,qitalic_p , italic_q over a finite state space ğ’®{\mathcal{S}}caligraphic_S, we have

Remark 6.

Note that the first inequality is tight if such sâ€‹(k,kâ€²)s(k,k^{\prime})italic_s ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is unique because sâ€‹(k,kâ€²)s(k,k^{\prime})italic_s ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is the only state from which kkitalic_k and kâ€²k^{\prime}italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT can be meaningfully distinguished. Also, if there are Wâ€‹(k,kâ€²)W(k,k^{\prime})italic_W ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) number of such sâ€‹(k,kâ€²)s(k,k^{\prime})italic_s ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )â€™s, then the lower bound can be improved to (logâ¡e2)â€‹Wâ€‹(k,kâ€²)â€‹Î±â€‹Î”2pmax\left(\log\frac{e}{2}\right)W(k,k^{\prime})\frac{\alpha\Delta^{2}}{p_{\max}}( roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ) italic_W ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG italic_Î± roman_Î” start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG.

Proof of LemmaÂ D.1.

The second inequality is due to Csiszar and Talata [2006, Lemma 6.1]. The first inequality is due to a Stackoverflow post and user Ze-Nan Liâ€™s answer, whose proof we reproduce here for completeness.

Let us define Î·(s):=qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s)pâ€‹(s)\eta(s)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\frac{q(s)-p(s)}{p(s)}italic_Î· ( italic_s ) : = divide start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG and partition ğ’®{\mathcal{S}}caligraphic_S as follows:

ğ’®={sâˆˆğ’®:Î·â€‹(s)>1}âŸâ‰œğ’®+â€‹âˆªË™â€‹{sâˆˆğ’®:Î·â€‹(s)â‰¤1}âŸâ‰œğ’®âˆ’.{\mathcal{S}}=\underbrace{\left\{s\in{\mathcal{S}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}\eta(s)>1\right\}}_{\triangleq{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}\dot{\cup}\underbrace{\left\{s\in{\mathcal{S}}\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}\eta(s)\leq 1\right\}}_{\triangleq{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}.caligraphic_S = underâŸ start_ARG { italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S : italic_Î· ( italic_s ) > 1 } end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT overË™ start_ARG âˆª end_ARG underâŸ start_ARG { italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S : italic_Î· ( italic_s ) â‰¤ 1 } end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰œ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (46)

Then it is easy to see that

  1. (i)

    For sâˆˆğ’®+s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, 1+Î·â€‹(s)â‰¤2Î·â€‹(s)=eÎ·â€‹(s)â€‹logâ¡21+\eta(s)\leq 2^{\eta(s)}=e^{\eta(s)\log 2}1 + italic_Î· ( italic_s ) â‰¤ 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î· ( italic_s ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î· ( italic_s ) roman_log 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and

  2. (ii)

    For sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, 1+Î·â€‹(s)â‰¤eÎ·â€‹(s)âˆ’câ€‹Î·â€‹(s)21+\eta(s)\leq e^{\eta(s)-c\eta(s)^{2}}1 + italic_Î· ( italic_s ) â‰¤ italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Î· ( italic_s ) - italic_c italic_Î· ( italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, where c:=loge2c\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\log\frac{e}{2}italic_c : = roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG.

Then,

ğ–ªğ–«â¡(p,q)\displaystyle\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}(p,q)sansserif_KL ( italic_p , italic_q ) :=âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®p(s)logpâ€‹(s)qâ€‹(s)\displaystyle\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}p(s)\log\frac{p(s)}{q(s)}: = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) roman_log divide start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) end_ARG
=âˆ’âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®+pâ€‹(s)â€‹logâ¡(1+Î·â€‹(s))âˆ’âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’pâ€‹(s)â€‹logâ¡(1+Î·â€‹(s))\displaystyle=-\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}p(s)\log(1+\eta(s))-\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}p(s)\log(1+\eta(s))= - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) roman_log ( 1 + italic_Î· ( italic_s ) ) - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) roman_log ( 1 + italic_Î· ( italic_s ) )
â‰¥âˆ’logâ¡2â€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®+pâ€‹(s)â€‹Î·â€‹(s)âˆ’âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’pâ€‹(s)â€‹(Î·â€‹(s)âˆ’câ€‹Î·â€‹(s)2)\displaystyle\geq-\log 2\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}p(s)\eta(s)-\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}p(s)(\eta(s)-c\eta(s)^{2})â‰¥ - roman_log 2 âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) italic_Î· ( italic_s ) - âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) ( italic_Î· ( italic_s ) - italic_c italic_Î· ( italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )
=câ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®+pâ€‹(s)â€‹Î·â€‹(s)âˆ’âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®pâ€‹(s)â€‹Î·â€‹(s)0+câ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’pâ€‹(s)â€‹Î·â€‹(s)2\displaystyle=c\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}p(s)\eta(s)-\cancelto{0}{\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}p(s)\eta(s)}+c\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}p(s)\eta(s)^{2}= italic_c âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) italic_Î· ( italic_s ) - SUPERSCRIPTOP cancel âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) italic_Î· ( italic_s ) 0 + italic_c âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_s ) italic_Î· ( italic_s ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
=câ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®+(qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s))+câ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’(qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s))2pâ€‹(s)\displaystyle=c\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}(q(s)-p(s))+c\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}\frac{(q(s)-p(s))^{2}}{p(s)}= italic_c âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) + italic_c âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG ( italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG
â‰¥câ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®+qâ€‹(s)â€‹qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s)qâ€‹(s)+cpmaxâ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’(qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s))2.\displaystyle\geq c\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}q(s)\frac{q(s)-p(s)}{q(s)}+\frac{c}{p_{\max}}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}(q(s)-p(s))^{2}.â‰¥ italic_c âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_s ) divide start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Now, for sâˆˆğ’®+s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have that 0<qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s)qâ€‹(s)â‰¤10<\frac{q(s)-p(s)}{q(s)}\leq 10 < divide start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) end_ARG â‰¤ 1, and thus,

ğ–ªğ–«â¡(p,q)\displaystyle\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}(p,q)sansserif_KL ( italic_p , italic_q ) â‰¥câ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®+qâ€‹(s)â€‹qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s)qâ€‹(s)+cpmaxâ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’(qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s))2\displaystyle\geq c\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}q(s)\frac{q(s)-p(s)}{q(s)}+\frac{c}{p_{\max}}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}(q(s)-p(s))^{2}â‰¥ italic_c âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_s ) divide start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
â‰¥câ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®+qâ€‹(s)â€‹(qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s)qâ€‹(s))2+cpmaxâ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’(qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s))2\displaystyle\geq c\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+}}q(s)\left(\frac{q(s)-p(s)}{q(s)}\right)^{2}+\frac{c}{p_{\max}}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}}(q(s)-p(s))^{2}â‰¥ italic_c âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_s ) ( divide start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + divide start_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
â‰¥cqmaxâˆ¨pmaxâ€‹âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®(qâ€‹(s)âˆ’pâ€‹(s))2âŸ=L2â€‹(p,q).\displaystyle\geq\frac{c}{q_{\max}\vee p_{\max}}\underbrace{\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}(q(s)-p(s))^{2}}_{=L_{2}(p,q)}.â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¨ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG underâŸ start_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_q ( italic_s ) - italic_p ( italic_s ) ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_q ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

âˆ

D.1.2 (b) Relationship between ğ’ŸÏ€{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Î”ğ–\Delta_{\mathbf{W}}roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Here, we provide the full statement of (b) and prove it:

Proposition D.1.

We have

Î”ğ‘¾2â‰¤minkâ‰ kâ€²â¡{2â€‹pmaxlogâ¡e2â€‹ğ’ŸÏ€(k,kâ€²)+4â€‹H2â€‹(Ï€(k),Ï€(kâ€²))},\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}\leq\min_{k\neq k^{\prime}}\left\{\frac{2p_{\max}}{\log\frac{e}{2}}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{(k,k^{\prime})}+4H^{2}\left(\pi^{(k)},\pi^{(k^{\prime})}\right)\right\},roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k â‰  italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { divide start_ARG 2 italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_ARG caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 4 italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) } , (47)

where H2â€‹(â‹…,â‹…)H^{2}(\cdot,\cdot)italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… , â‹… ) is the Hellinger distance: H2(p,q):=12(âˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®(pâ€‹(s)âˆ’qâ€‹(s))2)12H^{2}(p,q)\mathrel{\mathop{\ordinarycolon}}=\frac{1}{2}\left(\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}(\sqrt{p(s)}-\sqrt{q(s)})^{2}\right)^{\frac{1}{2}}italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_p , italic_q ) : = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ( âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( square-root start_ARG italic_p ( italic_s ) end_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_q ( italic_s ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Furthermore, we also have the following slightly more relaxed bound:

Î”ğ‘¾2â‰¤7â€‹(pmaxâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€+(âŒˆlogÏâ¡Mâˆ’1âŒ‰+11âˆ’Ï)â€‹12â€‹Ï€minâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€),\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}\leq 7\left(p_{\max}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}+\left(\lceil\log_{\rho}M^{-1}\rceil+\frac{1}{1-\rho}\right)\sqrt{\frac{1}{2\pi_{\min}}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}}\right),roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤ 7 ( italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( âŒˆ roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ï end_ARG ) square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) , (48)

where Ï\rhoitalic_Ï and MMitalic_M are the contraction constants from the definition of uniformly ergodic Markov chains888Recall that the Markov chain with stationary distribution Ï€\piitalic_Ï€ and transition matrix PPitalic_P is uniformly ergodic if there exists Ïâˆˆ(0,1)\rho\in(0,1)italic_Ï âˆˆ ( 0 , 1 ) and M>0M>0italic_M > 0 such that maxsâˆˆğ’®âˆ¥PH(s,â‹…),Ï€âˆ¥1â‰¤MÏH\max_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\left\lVert P^{H}(s,\cdot),\pi\right\rVert_{1}\leq M\rho^{H}roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¥ italic_P start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s , â‹… ) , italic_Ï€ âˆ¥ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_M italic_Ï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for all Hâˆˆâ„•H\in{\mathbb{N}}italic_H âˆˆ blackboard_N..

Proof.

For each sâˆˆğ’®s\in{\mathcal{S}}italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S,
