â‰¤2â€‹pmaxlogâ¡e2Ï€(k)(s)ğ–ªğ–«(p(k)(â‹…|s),p(kâ€²)(â‹…|s))+2(Ï€(k)â€‹(s)âˆ’Ï€(kâ€²)â€‹(s))2\displaystyle\leq\frac{2p_{\max}}{\log\frac{e}{2}}\pi^{(k)}(s)\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(p^{(k)}(\cdot|s),p^{(k^{\prime})}(\cdot|s)\right)+2\left(\sqrt{\pi^{(k)}(s)}-\sqrt{\pi^{(k^{\prime})}(s)}\right)^{2}â‰¤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) sansserif_KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) ) + 2 ( square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG - square-root start_ARG italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT (LemmaÂ D.1)

We conclude the first part by summing over sâˆˆğ’®s\in{\mathcal{S}}italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S and taking a minimum over kâ‰ kâ€²k\neq k^{\prime}italic_k â‰  italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT.

For the second part, we start by recalling Le Camâ€™s inequalityÂ [Tsybakov, 2009, Lemma 2.3]:

H2â€‹(Ï€(k),Ï€(kâ€²))â‰¤ğ–³ğ–µâ€‹(Ï€(k),Ï€(kâ€²)).H^{2}\left(\pi^{(k)},\pi^{(k^{\prime})}\right)\leq\mathsf{TV}\left(\pi^{(k)},\pi^{(k^{\prime})}\right).italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¤ sansserif_TV ( italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

We utilize the perturbation bound for Markov chainsÂ [Mitrophanov, 2005, Corollary 3.1] to obtain

ğ–³ğ–µâ€‹(Ï€(k),Ï€(kâ€²))\displaystyle\mathsf{TV}\left(\pi^{(k)},\pi^{(k^{\prime})}\right)sansserif_TV ( italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) â‰¤(âŒˆlogÏMâˆ’1âŒ‰+11âˆ’Ï)maxsâˆˆğ’®ğ–³ğ–µ(p(k)(â‹…|s),p(kâ€²)(â‹…|s))\displaystyle\leq\left(\lceil\log_{\rho}M^{-1}\rceil+\frac{1}{1-\rho}\right)\max_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\mathsf{TV}\left(p^{(k)}(\cdot|s),p^{(k^{\prime})}(\cdot|s)\right)â‰¤ ( âŒˆ roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ï end_ARG ) roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_TV ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) )
â‰¤(âŒˆlogÏâ¡Mâˆ’1âŒ‰+11âˆ’Ï)â€‹12maxsâˆˆğ’®ğ–ªğ–«(p(k)(â‹…|s),p(kâ€²)(â‹…|s))\displaystyle\leq\left(\lceil\log_{\rho}M^{-1}\rceil+\frac{1}{1-\rho}\right)\sqrt{\frac{1}{2}\max_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(p^{(k)}(\cdot|s),p^{(k^{\prime})}(\cdot|s)\right)}â‰¤ ( âŒˆ roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ï end_ARG ) square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT sansserif_KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) ) end_ARG (Pinskerâ€™s inequality)
â‰¤(âŒˆlogÏâ¡Mâˆ’1âŒ‰+11âˆ’Ï)â€‹12â€‹Ï€minâˆ‘sâˆˆğ’®Ï€(k)(s)ğ–ªğ–«(p(k)(â‹…|s),p(kâ€²)(â‹…|s))\displaystyle\leq\left(\lceil\log_{\rho}M^{-1}\rceil+\frac{1}{1-\rho}\right)\sqrt{\frac{1}{2\pi_{\min}}\sum_{s\in{\mathcal{S}}}\pi^{(k)}(s)\operatorname{{\mathsf{KL}}}\left(p^{(k)}(\cdot|s),p^{(k^{\prime})}(\cdot|s)\right)}â‰¤ ( âŒˆ roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ï end_ARG ) square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) sansserif_KL ( italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | italic_s ) ) end_ARG
=(âŒˆlogÏâ¡Mâˆ’1âŒ‰+11âˆ’Ï)â€‹12â€‹Ï€minâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€(k,kâ€²).\displaystyle=\left(\lceil\log_{\rho}M^{-1}\rceil+\frac{1}{1-\rho}\right)\sqrt{\frac{1}{2\pi_{\min}}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{(k,k^{\prime})}}.= ( âŒˆ roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ï end_ARG ) square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG .

As 2logâ¡e2<7\frac{2}{\log\frac{e}{2}}<7divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG italic_e end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_ARG < 7, we finally have that

Î”ğ‘¾2\displaystyle\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¤7â€‹minkâ‰ kâ€²â¡{pmaxâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€(k,kâ€²)+(âŒˆlogÏâ¡Mâˆ’1âŒ‰+11âˆ’Ï)â€‹12â€‹Ï€minâ€‹ğ’ŸÏ€(k,kâ€²)}\displaystyle\leq 7\min_{k\neq k^{\prime}}\left\{p_{\max}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{(k,k^{\prime})}+\left(\lceil\log_{\rho}M^{-1}\rceil+\frac{1}{1-\rho}\right)\sqrt{\frac{1}{2\pi_{\min}}{\mathcal{D}}_{\pi}^{(k,k^{\prime})}}\right\}â‰¤ 7 roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k â‰  italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ( âŒˆ roman_log start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ + divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ï end_ARG ) square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_min end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG caligraphic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_k , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG }

Î”ğ‘¾2â‰¥12â€‹Î±â€‹Î”2âˆ’((Î·Ï€âˆ’1)2âˆ¨(1âˆ’1Î·Ï€)2).\Delta_{\bm{W}}^{2}\geq\frac{1}{2}\alpha\Delta^{2}-\left((\sqrt{\eta_{\pi}}-1)^{2}\vee\left(1-\frac{1}{\sqrt{\eta_{\pi}}}\right)^{2}\right).roman_Î” start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG italic_Î± roman_Î” start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ( ( square-root start_ARG italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - 1 ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆ¨ ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_Î· start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Ï€ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) . D.2 Proof of PropositionÂ 5.2

We will construct an instance with K=2K=2italic_K = 2. For the state space ğ’®=[S]{\mathcal{S}}=[S]caligraphic_S = [ italic_S ] with Sâ‰¥2S\geq 2italic_S â‰¥ 2, assume that S=2â€‹Sâ€²S=2S^{\prime}italic_S = 2 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for some Sâ€²âˆˆâ„•S^{\prime}\in{\mathbb{N}}italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ blackboard_N. Let the state space be partitioned as ğ’®=ğ’®+â€‹âˆªË™â€‹ğ’®âˆ’{\mathcal{S}}={\mathcal{S}}_{+}\dot{\cup}{\mathcal{S}}_{-}caligraphic_S = caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT overË™ start_ARG âˆª end_ARG caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with ğ’®+=[Sâ€²]{\mathcal{S}}_{+}=[S^{\prime}]caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] and ğ’®âˆ’=[2â€‹Sâ€²]âˆ–[Sâ€²]{\mathcal{S}}_{-}=[2S^{\prime}]\setminus[S^{\prime}]caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ 2 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ] âˆ– [ italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ].

The two Markov chainsâ€™ transition kernels p(â‹…|â‹…)p(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p ( â‹… | â‹… ) and pâ€²(â‹…|â‹…)p^{\prime}(\cdot|\cdot)italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( â‹… | â‹… ) are defined as

pâ€‹(sâ€²|s)={32â€‹Sâ€²,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®+,12â€‹Sâ€²,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®âˆ’,pâ€²â€‹(sâ€²|s)={12â€‹Sâ€²,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®+,32â€‹Sâ€²,sâ€²âˆˆğ’®âˆ’p(s^{\prime}|s)=\begin{cases}\frac{3}{2S^{\prime}},&\quad s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+},\\ \frac{1}{2S^{\prime}},&\quad s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}\end{cases},\quad p^{\prime}(s^{\prime}|s)=\begin{cases}\frac{1}{2S^{\prime}},&\quad s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+},\\ \frac{3}{2S^{\prime}},&\quad s^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}\end{cases}italic_p ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 3 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW , italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | italic_s ) = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 3 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW (50)

Note that pmaxâ‰1Sp_{\max}\asymp\frac{1}{S}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰ divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_S end_ARG. Also, it is easy to check that their stationary distributions Ï€\piitalic_Ï€ and Ï€â€²\pi^{\prime}italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are given as

Ï€â€‹(s)={34â€‹Sâ€²,sâˆˆğ’®+,14â€‹Sâ€²,sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’,Ï€â€²â€‹(s)={14â€‹Sâ€²,sâˆˆğ’®+,34â€‹Sâ€²,sâˆˆğ’®âˆ’\pi(s)=\begin{cases}\frac{3}{4S^{\prime}},&\quad s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+},\\ \frac{1}{4S^{\prime}},&\quad s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}\end{cases},\quad\pi^{\prime}(s)=\begin{cases}\frac{1}{4S^{\prime}},&\quad s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{+},\\ \frac{3}{4S^{\prime}},&\quad s\in{\mathcal{S}}_{-}\end{cases}italic_Ï€ ( italic_s ) = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 3 end_ARG start_ARG 4 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 4 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW , italic_Ï€ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_s ) = { start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 4 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG 3 end_ARG start_ARG 4 italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG , end_CELL start_CELL italic_s âˆˆ caligraphic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW (51)

On the other hand, we have that
